Megan_Moroney:
{{Short description|American country music singer}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2024}} {{Infobox musical artist | background = person | name = Megan Moroney | image = Megan Moroney at The 57th Annual CMA Awards at Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, Tennessee on November 8, 2023 (cropped).jpg | image_upright = | image_size = | landscape = | alt = Moroney, styled in red lipstick and red dress, smiles for the photographer with the CMA Awards and ABC logos in back. | caption = Moroney at The 57th Annual CMA Awards at Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, Tennessee in 2023 | birth_name = Megan Ann Moroney | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1997|10|9}} | birth_place = [[Savannah, Georgia]], U.S. | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = {{hlist|Singer|songwriter}} | instrument = {{hlist|Vocals|guitar}} | years_active = 2021–present | label = {{hlist|[[Arista Nashville]]|[[Columbia Records|Columbia]]}} | spouse = | website = {{URL|https://www.meganmoroney.com/}} }} '''Megan Ann Moroney''' (born October 9, 1997) is an American [[country music]] singer and songwriter from [[Douglasville, Georgia]]. She charted her second single, "[[Tennessee Orange]]", in 2022. Her debut album ''[[Lucky (Megan Moroney album)|Lucky]]'' was released in May 2023, reaching the top 40 of the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. She released her second album, ''[[Am I Okay?]]'', in summer 2024. The first promotional single off the album, "Am I Okay", charted in the US. ==Biography== Moroney was born October 9, 1997, in [[Savannah, Georgia]].{{cite web | url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/megan-moroney-mn0004313820/biography | title=Megan Moroney biography | publisher=AllMusic | accessdate=February 15, 2023}}{{cite web|url=https://www.ascap.com/repertory#/ace/search/workID/919273137 |title=GIRL IN THE MIRROR |website=ASCAP |publisher=American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers |access-date=April 27, 2023}}{{cite web | url=https://www.upstarmusiconline.com/post/megan-moroney-is-paving-her-own-path-with-debut-single-wonder | title=Megan Moroney Is Paving Her Own Path With Debut Single 'Wonder' | publisher=Upstart Music Online | date=May 20, 2021 | accessdate=February 15, 2023}} She began listening to [[country music]] in her childhood and learned to play piano. Moroney went to [[Robert S. Alexander High School]] and participated in cheerleading and musical theater. While attending the [[University of Georgia]], she opened at a concert for [[Jon Langston]], as well as interned for [[Kristian Bush]] of [[Sugarland]]. Megan now writes/co-writes all of her own music.{{Cite web |last=Uitti |first=Jacob |date=2023-11-09 |title=Who is Megan Moroney |url=https://americansongwriter.com/who-is-megan-moroney/ |access-date=2024-03-16 |website=American Songwriter |language=en-US}} At the university, she was in the [[Kappa Delta]] sorority.https://people.com/country/megan-moroney-releases-debut-album-lucky-exclusive/ After completing her degree, she moved to [[Nashville, Tennessee]], in 2020 to begin a music career. She kept in contact with Bush, which led to him introducing her to other songwriters. She released her first single "Wonder" in 2021, which in turn led to her releasing an [[extended play]] titled ''Pistol Made of Roses''. Her next single release was "[[Tennessee Orange]]" in 2022, a track on which Bush served as producer. After the song's release, Moroney received attention on social media for wearing a [[Tennessee Volunteers]] shirt belonging to [[Morgan Wallen]]; it led to rumors that she was dating him, but Moroney remained neutral when asked if the two were in a relationship. After the song became popular through online streaming, Moroney signed with [[Arista Nashville]].{{cite web | url=https://musicmayhemmagazine.com/megan-moroney-signs-record-deal-confirms-shes-wearing-morgan-wallens-volunteers-shirt-in-tennessee-orange/ | title=Megan Moroney Signs Record Deal & Confirms She's Wearing Morgan Wallen's Volunteers' Shirt In "Tennessee Orange" | publisher=Music Mayhem Magazine | date=November 18, 2022 | accessdate=February 15, 2022}} In late 2022, "Tennessee Orange" debuted at number 94 on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], giving Moroney her first chart entry. At the time, the song also charted on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs]] and [[Country Airplay]].{{cite web | url=https://www.billboard.com/music/chart-beat/megan-moroney-debuts-hot-100-tennessee-orange-1235154011/ | title=Hot 100 First-Timers: Megan Moroney Arrives With Country Love Song 'Tennessee Orange' | publisher=Billboard | date=October 11, 2022 | accessdate=February 15, 2023}} Arista Nashville closed while the song was climbing the charts, and as a result, Moroney was transferred to [[Columbia Records]] Nashville.{{cite web | url=https://variety.com/2023/music/news/sony-dissolves-arista-nashville-1235563003/ | title=Sony Music Dissolves Arista Nashville Label | publisher=Variety | date=March 23, 2023 | accessdate=March 27, 2023 | author=Jem Aswad}} On May 5, 2023, Moroney released her debut album ''[[Lucky (Megan Moroney album)|Lucky]]''.{{Cite web |title=Megan Moroney Releases Debut Album – Sony Music Canada |url=https://www.sonymusic.ca/press_release/megan-moroney-releases-debut-album |access-date=2024-01-14 |website=www.sonymusic.ca}} The album featured the singles "[[Tennessee Orange]]" and "[[I'm Not Pretty]]". The album reached the top 40 of the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]]. The album was named as the Best Country and American album of 2023 by [[Rolling Stone]] with writer Jonathan Bernstein saying the Moroney created a 'casual, youth-conversant tone makes it shine and comes naturally'.{{Cite magazine |date=2023-12-15 |title=The 25 Best Country and Americana Albums of 2023 |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country-lists/best-country-music-albums-2023-1234925430/ |access-date=2024-01-14 |magazine=Rolling Stone |language=en-US}} A deluxe version of the album was released on the 22nd of September.{{Cite web |last=Hollabaugh |first=Lorie |date=2023-09-22 |title=Megan Moroney Drops Deluxe Edition Of Debut Album 'Lucky' |url=https://musicrow.com/2023/09/megan-moroney-drops-deluxe-edition-of-debut-album-lucky/ |access-date=2024-01-14 |website=MusicRow.com |language=en-US}} Moroney released a cover version of [[Chris Stapleton]]'s 2013 single "What Are You Listening To?" as an [[Amazon Music]] exclusive on October 6, 2023.{{Cite web |title=Megan Moroney Releases Cover of Chris Stapleton's 'What Are You Listening To?' {{!}} Holler |url=https://holler.country/news/breaking/megan-moroney-releases-cover-of-chris-stapletons-what-are-you-listening-to |access-date=2024-01-14 |website=holler.country |language=en}} The song was released on other streaming platforms in January 2024. Since then, she has released a song with Old Dominion titled "Can't Break Up Now", a single "No Caller ID", and the deluxe version of her debut album ''Lucky''. On May 2, 2024, Moroney announced her second album ''[[Am I Okay?]]'' It was released on July 12, 2024.{{cite web |url=https://musicrow.com/2024/05/megan-moroney-slates-anticipated-sophomore-album-for-july |title=Megan Moroney Slates Anticipates Sophomore Album for July |author=LB Cantrell |website=Music Row |date=May 2, 2024 |access-date=May 4, 2024}} ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of albums, with selected details and chart positions ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:11em;"| Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" style="width:22em;"| Details ! scope="col" colspan="3"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2" |Certifications |- ! scope="col" style="width:3em;font-size:90%"| [[Billboard 200|US]]
